In Russia, a plane crash in the northern Republic of Karelia kills 44 people.
In Syria, tens of thousands gather for pro - Assad rallies, a day after he blamed the country's unrest on saboteurs.
At least 21 are killed in a suicide bombing attack outside the home of the local governor in central Iraq.
In Northern Ireland, violence erupts between Protestants and Catholics ahead of the annual marching season.
In Rwanda, the government erects mini hydropower stations to meet the growing energy demand in rural areas.
Expectant fathers attend a training camp in Beijing, China.
